title.raw: 《張丞相列傳》 Biography of Chancellor Zhang

sentences.zh: 張丞相蒼者，陽武人也。

translations.literal: Zhang chancellor Cang person, Yang Wu person.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Cang, the Chancellor, was a man from Yangwu.

sentences.zh: 好書律歷。

translations.literal: Good book laws calendars.
translations.idiomatic: He was fond of books, laws, and calendars.

sentences.zh: 秦時為御史，主柱下方書。

translations.literal: Qin time be censor, main pillar below square book.
translations.idiomatic: During Qin times he served as a censor in charge of the square books below the pillar.

sentences.zh: 有罪，亡歸。

translations.literal: Have crime, flee return.
translations.idiomatic: He committed a crime and fled back home.

sentences.zh: 及沛公略地過陽武，蒼以客從攻南陽。

translations.literal: Reach Pei gong raid land pass Yang Wu, Cang with guest follow attack Nan Yang.
translations.idiomatic: When the Duke of Pei was raiding territory and passed through Yangwu, Cang followed as a guest to attack Nanyang.

sentences.zh: 蒼坐法當斬，解衣伏質，身長大，肥白如瓠，時王陵見而怪其美士，乃言沛公，赦勿斬。

translations.literal: Cang sit law should behead, loosen clothes lie on block, body tall big, fat white like gourd, at time Wang Ling see and marvel his beautiful gentleman, then speak Pei gong, pardon not behead.
translations.idiomatic: Cang was convicted by law and should be beheaded. He loosened his clothes and lay on the execution block. His body was tall and large, fat and white like a gourd. At the time Wang Ling saw him and marveled at this beautiful gentleman, so he spoke to the Duke of Pei, who pardoned him and did not behead him.

sentences.zh: 遂從西入武關，至咸陽。

translations.literal: Then follow west enter Wu Guan, arrive Xian Yang.
translations.idiomatic: He then followed west through Wuguan and arrived at Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 沛公立為漢王，入漢中，還定三秦。

translations.literal: Pei gong establish as Han wang, enter Han middle, return settle three Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei was established as King of Han, entered Hanzhong, and returned to settle the Three Qin.

sentences.zh: 陳餘擊走常山王張耳，耳歸漢，漢乃以張蒼為常山守。

translations.literal: Chen Yu strike drive away Chang Shan wang Zhang Er, Er return Han, Han then with Zhang Cang as Chang Shan guard.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu struck and drove away Changshan king Zhang Er. Er returned to Han, and Han then made Zhang Cang Changshan governor.

sentences.zh: 從淮陰侯擊趙，蒼得陳餘。

translations.literal: Follow Huai Yin marquis strike Zhao, Cang obtain Chen Yu.
translations.idiomatic: He followed Marquis Huaiyin in striking Zhao, and Cang captured Chen Yu.

sentences.zh: 趙地已平，漢王以蒼為代相，備邊寇。

translations.literal: Zhao land already pacify, Han wang with Cang as Dai chancellor, prepare border bandits.
translations.idiomatic: Once Zhao lands were pacified, the Han king made Cang chancellor of Dai to prepare against border bandits.

sentences.zh: 已而徙為趙相，相趙王耳。

translations.literal: Already then move as Zhao chancellor, chancellor Zhao wang Er.
translations.idiomatic: Soon after he was moved to serve as chancellor of Zhao, chancellor to Zhao king Er.

sentences.zh: 耳卒，相趙王敖。

translations.literal: Er die, chancellor Zhao wang Ao.
translations.idiomatic: Er died, and he served as chancellor to Zhao king Ao.

sentences.zh: 復徙相代王。

translations.literal: Again move chancellor Dai wang.
translations.idiomatic: He was again moved to serve as chancellor to the Dai king.

sentences.zh: 燕王臧荼反，高祖往擊之。

translations.literal: Yan wang Zang Tu rebel, Gao Zu go strike it.
translations.idiomatic: Yan king Zang Tu rebelled, and Gaozu went to strike him.

sentences.zh: 蒼以代相從攻臧荼有功，以六年中封為北平侯，食邑千二百戶。

translations.literal: Cang with Dai chancellor follow attack Zang Tu have merit, with six year middle enfeoff as Bei Ping marquis, food fief thousand two hundred households.
translations.idiomatic: Cang as Dai chancellor followed in attacking Zang Tu with merit. In the middle of the sixth year he was enfeoffed as Marquis of Beiping, with a food fief of one thousand two hundred households.

translations.literal: Zhang Cang, the Chancellor, hailed from Yangwu. He had a passion for texts on law and calendrical systems. During the Qin dynasty, he served as an imperial secretary overseeing the archives beneath the pillar. Having committed an offense, he fled back to his home region. When the Duke of Pei led troops to seize territory between Xiao and Pei, Xiao He, as the chief clerk of Pei county, recommended Cang and sent him to join the army. Xiao He, as the chief clerk of Pei county, recommended Cang and sent him to join the army. Cang followed as a guest in the attack on Nanyang. Because Cang had been a Qin imperial secretary, he understood the laws and regulations well. He handled military affairs properly and was promoted to governor of Changshan. He was assigned to General Zhao, who esteemed him highly. Cang served as governor of Changshan and was assigned to General Zhao. The lands of Zhao were already pacified, and the Han king appointed Cang as prime minister of Dai to defend the borders.

sentences.zh: 遷為計相，一月，更以列侯為主計四歲。

translations.literal: Move as accounting chancellor, one month, change with ranked marquis as chief accountant four years.
translations.idiomatic: He was moved to serve as accounting chancellor. After one month, he was changed to serve as chief accountant for four years as a ranked marquis.

sentences.zh: 是時蕭何為相國，而張蒼乃自秦時為柱下史，明習天下圖書計籍。

translations.literal: This time Xiao He be prime minister, but Zhang Cang then from Qin time be pillar below historian, clear practice world maps books accounting records.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Xiao He served as prime minister, but Zhang Cang had since Qin times served as the historian below the pillar, clearly versed in the world's maps, books, and accounting records.

sentences.zh: 蒼又善用算律歷，故令蒼以列侯居相府，領主郡國上計者。

translations.literal: Cang again good use calculation laws calendars, therefore order Cang with ranked marquis reside prime minister mansion, lead chief commanderies states submit accounts.
translations.idiomatic: Cang was again skilled in using calculations, laws, and calendars, so he was ordered to reside in the prime minister's mansion as a ranked marquis, leading those in charge of commandery and state account submissions.

sentences.zh: 黥布反亡，漢立皇子長為淮南王，而張蒼相之。

translations.literal: Qing Bu rebel flee, Han establish imperial son Chang as Huai Nan wang, but Zhang Cang chancellor him.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Bu rebelled and fled. Han established imperial son Chang as King of Huainan, and Zhang Cang served as his chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十四年，遷為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Fourteen year, move as censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, he was moved to serve as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 周昌者，沛人也。

translations.literal: Zhou Chang person, Pei person.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang was a man from Pei.

sentences.zh: 其從兄曰周苛，秦時皆為泗水卒史。

translations.literal: His follow elder brother called Zhou Ke, Qin time all be Si Shui soldier secretary.
translations.idiomatic: His elder cousin was called Zhou Ke. During Qin times they both served as soldier secretaries in Sishui.

sentences.zh: 及高祖起沛，擊破泗水守監，於是周昌、周苛自卒史從沛公，沛公以周昌為職志，周苛為客。

translations.literal: Reach Gao Zu rise Pei, strike break Si Shui guard supervisor, then Zhou Chang, Zhou Ke from soldier secretary follow Pei gong, Pei gong with Zhou Chang as duty record, Zhou Ke as guest.
translations.idiomatic: When Gaozu rose at Pei and struck and broke the Sishui guard and supervisor, then Zhou Chang and Zhou Ke followed the Duke of Pei from their positions as soldier secretaries. The Duke of Pei made Zhou Chang duty recorder and Zhou Ke a guest.

sentences.zh: 從入關，破秦。

translations.literal: Follow enter pass, break Qin.
translations.idiomatic: They followed in entering the pass and breaking Qin.

sentences.zh: 沛公立為漢王，以周苛為御史大夫，周昌為中尉。

translations.literal: Pei gong establish as Han wang, with Zhou Ke as censor grand master, Zhou Chang as central commandery captain.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei was established as King of Han. He made Zhou Ke Censor Grand Master and Zhou Chang Central Commandery Captain.

sentences.zh: 漢王四年，楚圍漢王滎陽急，漢王遁出去，而使周苛守滎陽城。

translations.literal: Han wang four year, Chu surround Han wang Xing Yang urgent, Han wang flee go out, but make Zhou Ke guard Xing Yang city.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of the Han king, Chu urgently surrounded the Han king at Xingyang. The Han king fled out, but sent Zhou Ke to guard Xingyang city.

sentences.zh: 楚破滎陽城，欲令周苛將。

translations.literal: Chu break Xing Yang city, wish make Zhou Ke lead.
translations.idiomatic: Chu broke Xingyang city and wished to make Zhou Ke lead.

sentences.zh: 苛罵曰：「若趣降漢王！

translations.literal: Ke curse say: You hasten surrender Han wang!
translations.idiomatic: Ke cursed and said: 'You hasten to surrender to the Han king!'

sentences.zh: 不然，今為虜矣！」

translations.literal: Not so, now become captives!
translations.idiomatic: If not, you will now become captives!'

sentences.zh: 項羽怒，亨周苛。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu angry, cook Zhou Ke.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was angry and cooked Zhou Ke.

sentences.zh: 於是乃拜周昌為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Then then appoint Zhou Chang as censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Then he appointed Zhou Chang as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 常從擊破項籍。

translations.literal: Often follow strike break Xiang Ji.
translations.idiomatic: He often followed in striking and breaking Xiang Ji.

sentences.zh: 以六年中與蕭、曹等俱封：封周昌為汾陰侯；

translations.literal: With six year middle and Xiao, Cao etc together enfeoff: enfeoff Zhou Chang as Fen Yin marquis;
translations.idiomatic: In the middle of the sixth year he was together enfeoffed with Xiao, Cao, and others: Zhou Chang was enfeoffed as Marquis of Fenyin;

sentences.zh: 周苛子周成以父死事，封為高景侯。

translations.literal: Zhou Ke son Zhou Cheng with father die affairs, enfeoff as Gao Jing marquis.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke's son Zhou Cheng, for his father's death in service, was enfeoffed as Marquis of Gaojing.

sentences.zh: 昌為人彊力，敢直言，自蕭、曹等皆卑下之。

translations.literal: Chang as person strong force, dare straight speak, from Xiao, Cao etc all lowly treat him.
translations.idiomatic: Chang as a person was strong and forceful, daring to speak directly. Even Xiao, Cao, and others all treated him with deference.

sentences.zh: 昌嘗燕時入奏事，高帝方擁戚姬，昌還走，高帝逐得，騎周昌項，問曰：「我何如主也？」

translations.literal: Chang once feast time enter memorialize affairs, Gao Di just embrace Qi consort, Chang return run, Gao Di chase obtain, ride Zhou Chang neck, ask say: I what like sovereign?
translations.idiomatic: Once during a feast Chang entered to memorialize affairs. The Gao Emperor was just embracing Consort Qi. Chang returned and ran. The Gao Emperor chased and caught him, rode on Zhou Chang's neck, and asked: 'What kind of sovereign am I?'

sentences.zh: 昌仰曰：「陛下即桀紂之主也。」

translations.literal: Chang look up say: Your majesty namely Jie Zhou of sovereign.
translations.idiomatic: Chang looked up and said: 'Your Majesty is namely a sovereign like Jie and Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 於是上笑之，然尤憚周昌。

translations.literal: Then sovereign laugh it, however especially fear Zhou Chang.
translations.idiomatic: Then the sovereign laughed at it, but especially feared Zhou Chang.

sentences.zh: 及帝欲廢太子，而立戚姬子如意為太子，大臣固爭之，莫能得；

translations.literal: Reach emperor wish abolish crown prince, and establish Qi consort son Ru Yi as crown prince, great ministers firmly dispute it, none able obtain;
translations.idiomatic: When the emperor wished to abolish the crown prince and establish Consort Qi's son Ruyi as crown prince, the great ministers firmly disputed it, but none could prevail;

sentences.zh: 上以留侯策即止。

translations.literal: Sovereign with Liu Hou strategy then stop.
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign stopped because of Marquis Liu's strategy.

sentences.zh: 而周昌廷爭之彊，上問其說，昌為人吃，又盛怒，曰：「臣口不能言，然臣期期知其不可。

translations.literal: But Zhou Chang court dispute it strong, sovereign ask its explanation, Chang as person stutter, again great anger, say: Minister mouth not able speak, however minister qi qi know its not able.
translations.idiomatic: But Zhou Chang disputed it strongly in court. The sovereign asked for his explanation. Chang as a person stuttered, and was greatly angered again, saying: 'This minister's mouth cannot speak, but this minister qi qi knows it is not possible.

sentences.zh: 陛下雖欲廢太子，臣期期不奉詔。」

translations.literal: Your majesty though wish abolish crown prince, minister qi qi not receive decree.
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty though wishes to abolish the crown prince, this minister qi qi will not receive the decree.'

sentences.zh: 上欣然而笑。

translations.literal: Sovereign happily laugh.
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign laughed happily.

sentences.zh: 既罷，呂后側耳於東箱聽，見周昌，為跪謝曰：「微君，太子幾廢。」

translations.literal: Already dismiss, Lu empress incline ear at east chamber listen, see Zhou Chang, for kneel thank say: Without you, crown prince almost abolish.
translations.idiomatic: After it was dismissed, Empress Lu inclined her ear to listen from the eastern chamber. Seeing Zhou Chang, she knelt and thanked him saying: 'Without you, the crown prince would almost have been abolished.'

sentences.zh: 是後戚姬子如意為趙王，年十歲，高祖憂即萬歲之後不全也。

translations.literal: This after Qi consort son Ru Yi be Zhao wang, year ten, Gao Zu worry immediately ten thousand years after not whole.
translations.idiomatic: After this, Consort Qi's son Ruyi became Zhao king, aged ten. Gaozu worried that after his ten thousand years he would not be whole.

sentences.zh: 趙堯年少，為符璽御史。

translations.literal: Zhao Yao year young, be tally seal censor.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yao was young in years, serving as tally and seal censor.

sentences.zh: 趙人方與公謂御史大夫周昌曰：「君之史趙堯，年雖少，然奇才也，君必異之，是且代君之位。」

translations.literal: Zhao person Fang Yu gong tell censor grand master Zhou Chang say: Your of secretary Zhao Yao, year though young, however strange talent, you must different treat him, this and replace your position.
translations.idiomatic: A Zhao person Fang Yugong told Censor Grand Master Zhou Chang: 'Your secretary Zhao Yao, though young in years, is nevertheless a strange talent. You must treat him differently. He will replace your position.'

sentences.zh: 周昌笑曰；

translations.literal: Zhou Chang laugh say;
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang laughed and said:

sentences.zh: 「堯年少，刀筆吏耳，何能至是乎！」

translations.literal: Yao year young, knife brush official ear, what able arrive this!
translations.idiomatic: 'Yao is young, just a knife and brush official, how could he reach this!'

sentences.zh: 居頃之，趙堯侍高祖。

translations.literal: Reside period of time, Zhao Yao attend Gao Zu.
translations.idiomatic: After a short time, Zhao Yao attended Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖獨心不樂，悲歌，群臣不知上之所以然。

translations.literal: Gao Zu alone heart not happy, sad song, group ministers not know sovereign of so cause.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu alone was unhappy in heart, sang sadly. The group of ministers did not know the cause of the sovereign's sadness.

sentences.zh: 趙堯進請問曰：「陛下所為不樂，非為趙王年少而戚夫人與呂后有卻邪？

translations.literal: Zhao Yao advance request ask say: Your majesty what for not happy, not for Zhao wang year young and Qi consort with Lu empress have grudge?
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yao advanced and requested to ask: 'Your Majesty is unhappy because of this - is it not because Zhao king is young in years and Consort Qi has a grudge with Empress Lu?'

sentences.zh: 備萬歲之後而趙王不能自全乎？」

translations.literal: Prepare ten thousand years after but Zhao wang not able self preserve?
translations.idiomatic: 'Preparing for after ten thousand years and Zhao king cannot preserve himself?'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「然。

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: Correct.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'Correct.

sentences.zh: 吾私憂之，不知所出。」

translations.literal: I private worry it, not know what exit.
translations.idiomatic: I privately worry about it, and do not know what to do.'

sentences.zh: 堯曰：「陛下獨宜為趙王置貴彊相，及呂后、太子、群臣素所敬憚乃可。」

translations.literal: Yao say: Your majesty alone should for Zhao wang establish noble strong chancellor, and Lu empress, crown prince, group ministers always what revere fear then can.
translations.idiomatic: Yao said: 'Your Majesty alone should establish a noble and strong chancellor for Zhao king, one whom Empress Lu, the crown prince, and the group of ministers have always revered and feared, then it will be possible.'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「然。

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: Correct.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'Correct.

sentences.zh: 吾念之欲如是，而群臣誰可者？」

translations.literal: I think it want like this, but group ministers who suitable ones?
translations.idiomatic: I think of it and want it to be like this, but which of the group of ministers would be suitable?'

sentences.zh: 堯曰：「御史大夫周昌，其人堅忍質直，且自呂后、太子及大臣皆素敬憚之。

translations.literal: Yao say: Censor grand master Zhou Chang, his person firm endure simple straight, moreover from Lu empress, crown prince and great ministers all always revere fear him.
translations.idiomatic: Yao said: 'Censor Grand Master Zhou Chang - his person is firm, enduring, simple, and straight, and moreover Empress Lu, the crown prince, and the great ministers have all always revered and feared him.

sentences.zh: 獨昌可。」

translations.literal: Alone Chang suitable.
translations.idiomatic: Alone Chang is suitable.'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: Good.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃召周昌，謂曰：「吾欲固煩公，公彊為我相趙王。」

translations.literal: Then then summon Zhou Chang, tell say: I wish indeed trouble you, you strong for me chancellor Zhao wang.
translations.idiomatic: Then he summoned Zhou Chang and said: 'I wish to indeed trouble you. You must strongly serve as my chancellor for Zhao king.'

sentences.zh: 周昌泣曰：「臣初起從陛下，陛下獨柰何中道而棄之於諸侯乎？」

translations.literal: Zhou Chang weep say: Minister initial rise follow your majesty, your majesty alone how middle way and abandon him at feudal lords?
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang wept and said: 'This minister initially rose following Your Majesty. How can Your Majesty alone abandon him midway to the feudal lords?'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「吾極知其左遷，然吾私憂趙王，念非公無可者。

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: I extremely know its demotion, however I private worry Zhao wang, think not you no suitable ones.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'I extremely know this is a demotion for him, but I privately worry about Zhao king. I think there is no one suitable except you.

sentences.zh: 公不得已彊行！」

translations.literal: You have no alternative strong go!
translations.idiomatic: You have no alternative but to go strongly!'

sentences.zh: 於是徙御史大夫周昌為趙相。

translations.literal: Then move censor grand master Zhou Chang as Zhao chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Then he moved Censor Grand Master Zhou Chang to serve as Zhao chancellor.

sentences.zh: 既行久之，高祖持御史大夫印弄之，曰：「誰可以為御史大夫者？」

translations.literal: Already go long time, Gao Zu hold censor grand master seal play it, say: Who can be censor grand master ones?
translations.idiomatic: After he had gone for a long time, Gaozu held the Censor Grand Master seal and played with it, saying: 'Who can serve as Censor Grand Master?'

sentences.zh: 孰視趙堯，曰：「無以易堯。」

translations.literal: Fixed gaze Zhao Yao, say: No with change Yao.
translations.idiomatic: He fixed his gaze on Zhao Yao and said: 'There is no one to change for Yao.'

sentences.zh: 遂拜趙堯為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Then appoint Zhao Yao as censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Then he appointed Zhao Yao as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 堯亦前有軍功食邑，及以御史大夫從擊陳豨有功，封為江邑侯。

translations.literal: Yao also before have military merit food fief, and with censor grand master follow strike Chen Xi have merit, enfeoff as Jiang Yi marquis.
translations.idiomatic: Yao also previously had military merit with a food fief, and as Censor Grand Master followed in striking Chen Xi with merit, was enfeoffed as Marquis of Jiangyi.

sentences.zh: 高祖崩，呂太后使使召趙王，其相周昌令王稱疾不行。

translations.literal: Gao Zu collapse, Lu empress dowager make messenger summon Zhao wang, his chancellor Zhou Chang command wang claim illness not go.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu collapsed. Empress Dowager Lu sent a messenger to summon Zhao king. His chancellor Zhou Chang commanded the king to claim illness and not go.

sentences.zh: 使者三反，周昌固為不遣趙王。

translations.literal: Messenger three return, Zhou Chang firmly for not send Zhao wang.
translations.idiomatic: The messenger returned three times. Zhou Chang firmly refused to send Zhao king.

sentences.zh: 於是高后患之，乃使使召周昌。

translations.literal: Then Gao empress dowager worry it, then make messenger summon Zhou Chang.
translations.idiomatic: Then Empress Dowager Gao worried about it and sent a messenger to summon Zhou Chang.

sentences.zh: 周昌至，謁高后，高后怒而罵周昌曰：「爾不知我之怨戚氏乎？

translations.literal: Zhou Chang arrive, announce Gao empress dowager, Gao empress dowager angry and curse Zhou Chang say: You not know I of grudge Qi clan?
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang arrived and announced himself to Empress Dowager Gao. Empress Dowager Gao angrily cursed Zhou Chang saying: 'Don't you know of my grudge against the Qi clan?'

sentences.zh: 而不遣趙王，何？」

translations.literal: But not send Zhao wang, what?
translations.idiomatic: 'And you don't send Zhao king, why?'

sentences.zh: 昌既徵，高后使使召趙王，趙王果來。

translations.literal: Chang already summoned, Gao empress dowager make messenger summon Zhao wang, Zhao wang indeed come.
translations.idiomatic: After Chang was summoned, Empress Dowager Gao sent a messenger to summon Zhao king. Zhao king indeed came.

sentences.zh: 至長安月餘，飲藥而死。

translations.literal: Arrive Chang An month more, drink medicine and die.
translations.idiomatic: He arrived at Chang'an after more than a month and died from drinking medicine.

sentences.zh: 周昌因謝病不朝見，三歲而死。

translations.literal: Zhou Chang because apologize illness not court audience, three years and die.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Chang because of claiming illness did not appear at court audiences. After three years he died.

sentences.zh: 後五歲，高后聞御史大夫江邑侯趙堯高祖時定趙王如意之畫，乃抵堯罪，以廣阿侯任敖為御史大夫。

translations.literal: After five years, Gao empress dowager hear censor grand master Jiang Yi marquis Zhao Yao Gao Zu time decide Zhao wang Ru Yi of plan, then charge Yao crime, with Guang A marquis Ren Ao as censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: After five years, Empress Dowager Gao heard that Censor Grand Master Jiangyi marquis Zhao Yao had during Gaozu's time decided on the plan for Zhao king Ruyi. Then she charged Yao with a crime and made Guang A marquis Ren Ao Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 任敖者，故沛獄吏。

translations.literal: Ren Ao person, former Pei prison official.
translations.idiomatic: Ren Ao was a former Pei prison official.

sentences.zh: 高祖嘗辟吏，吏系呂后，遇之不謹。

translations.literal: Gao Zu once avoid official, official arrest Lu empress, treat her not respectfully.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu once avoided an official. The official arrested Empress Lu and treated her disrespectfully.

sentences.zh: 任敖素善高祖，怒，擊傷主呂后吏。

translations.literal: Ren Ao always good Gao Zu, angry, strike injure main Lu empress official.
translations.idiomatic: Ren Ao had always been on good terms with Gaozu. He was angry and struck and injured the official in charge of Empress Lu.

sentences.zh: 及高祖初起，敖以客從為御史，守豐二歲，高祖立為漢王，東擊項籍，敖遷為上黨守。

translations.literal: Reach Gao Zu initial rise, Ao with guest follow be censor, guard Feng two years, Gao Zu establish as Han wang, east strike Xiang Ji, Ao move as Shang Dang guard.
translations.idiomatic: When Gaozu initially rose, Ao followed as a guest to serve as censor. He guarded Feng for two years. Gaozu was established as Han king and went east to strike Xiang Ji. Ao was moved to serve as Shangdang governor.

sentences.zh: 陳豨反時，敖堅守，封為廣阿侯，食千八百戶。

translations.literal: Chen Xi rebel time, Ao firm guard, enfeoff as Guang A marquis, food thousand eight hundred households.
translations.idiomatic: During Chen Xi's rebellion, Ao firmly guarded his position and was enfeoffed as Marquis of Guang A, with a food fief of one thousand eight hundred households.

sentences.zh: 高后時為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Gao empress dowager time be censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: During Empress Dowager Gao's time he served as Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 三歲免，以平陽侯曹窋為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Three years dismiss, with Ping Yang marquis Cao Jiu as censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: After three years he was dismissed, and Pingyang marquis Cao Jiu was made Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 高后崩，（不）與大臣共誅呂祿等。

translations.literal: Gao empress dowager collapse, with great ministers together execute Lu Lu etc.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Dowager Gao collapsed and together with the great ministers executed Lu Lu and others.

sentences.zh: 免，以淮南相張蒼為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Dismiss, with Huai Nan chancellor Zhang Cang as censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: He was dismissed, and Huainan chancellor Zhang Cang was made Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 蒼與絳侯等尊立代王為孝文皇帝。

translations.literal: Cang with Jiang marquis etc honor establish Dai wang as Xiao Wen emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Cang together with the Jiang marquis and others honored and established the Dai king as Emperor Xiaowen.

sentences.zh: 四年，丞相灌嬰卒，張蒼為丞相。

translations.literal: Four year, chancellor Guan Ying die, Zhang Cang be chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Chancellor Guan Ying died, and Zhang Cang became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 自漢興至孝文二十餘年，會天下初定，將相公卿皆軍吏。

translations.literal: From Han rise to Xiao Wen twenty more years, meet world initial settle, generals chancellors dukes ministers all military officials.
translations.idiomatic: From Han's rise to over twenty years into Xiaowen's reign, as the world was initially settling, the generals, chancellors, dukes, and ministers were all military officials.

sentences.zh: 張蒼為計相時，緒正律歷。

translations.literal: Zhang Cang be accounting chancellor time, continue correct laws calendars.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhang Cang served as accounting chancellor, he continued to correct the laws and calendars.

sentences.zh: 以高祖十月始至霸上，因故秦時本以十月為歲首，弗革。

translations.literal: With Gao Zu ten month begin arrive Ba Shang, follow old Qin time originally with ten month as year beginning, not change.
translations.idiomatic: Because Gaozu in the tenth month began arriving at Bashang, following the old Qin practice which originally used the tenth month as the year's beginning, he did not change it.

sentences.zh: 推五德之運，以為漢當水德之時，尚黑如故。

translations.literal: Push five virtues of movement, think Han when water virtue of time, esteem black like old.
translations.idiomatic: He calculated the progression of the Five Virtues, thinking that Han was in the time of water virtue, esteeming black as before.

sentences.zh: 吹律調樂，入之音聲，及以比定律令。

translations.literal: Blow pitchpipes tune music, enter it sound voice, and with compare determine laws commands.
translations.idiomatic: He blew the pitchpipes to tune music, incorporated them into the musical sounds, and used comparisons to determine the laws and commands.

sentences.zh: 若百工，天下作程品。

translations.literal: Like hundred artisans, world make standard grades.
translations.idiomatic: Like the hundred artisans, he made standards and grades for the world.

sentences.zh: 至於為丞相，卒就之，故漢家言律歷者，本之張蒼。

translations.literal: Until be chancellor, finally complete it, therefore Han family speak laws calendars ones, base it Zhang Cang.
translations.idiomatic: Until he became chancellor, he finally completed it. Therefore, when the Han family spoke of laws and calendars, they based it on Zhang Cang.

sentences.zh: 蒼本好書，無所不觀，無所不通，而尤善律歷。

translations.literal: Cang originally good books, nothing not observe, nothing not pass through, but especially good laws calendars.
translations.idiomatic: Cang was originally fond of books, observing nothing without seeing it, passing through nothing without understanding it, but he was especially skilled in laws and calendars.

sentences.zh: 張蒼德王陵。

translations.literal: Zhang Cang virtue Wang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Cang was virtuous to Wang Ling.

sentences.zh: 王陵者，安國侯也。

translations.literal: Wang Ling person, An Guo marquis.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Ling was the Marquis of Anguo.

sentences.zh: 及蒼貴，常父事王陵。

translations.literal: Reach Cang noble, often father serve Wang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: When Cang became noble, he often served Wang Ling as a father.

sentences.zh: 陵死後，蒼為丞相，洗沐，常先朝陵夫人上食，然後敢歸家。

translations.literal: Ling die after, Cang be chancellor, wash bathe, often first morning visit Ling wife present food, then dare return home.
translations.idiomatic: After Ling died, Cang became chancellor. On his days off, he would always first visit Lady Ling in the morning to present food, and only then dare return home.

sentences.zh: 蒼為丞相十餘年，魯人公孫臣上書言漢土德時，其符有黃龍當見。

translations.literal: Cang be chancellor ten more years, Lu person Gong Sun Chen submit book speak Han earth virtue time, its omen have yellow dragon should appear.
translations.idiomatic: Cang served as chancellor for over ten years. A man from Lu named Gongsun Chen submitted a memorial saying Han was in the time of earth virtue, and its omen was that a yellow dragon should appear.

sentences.zh: 詔下其議張蒼，張蒼以為非是，罷之。

translations.literal: Decree descend its discuss Zhang Cang, Zhang Cang think not is, dismiss it.
translations.idiomatic: The decree sent it down for Zhang Cang to discuss. Zhang Cang thought it was not correct and dismissed it.

sentences.zh: 其後黃龍見成紀，於是文帝召公孫臣以為博士，草土德之歷制度，更元年。

translations.literal: Its after yellow dragon appear Cheng Ji, then Wen emperor summon Gong Sun Chen as doctor, draft earth virtue of calendar system, change first year.
translations.idiomatic: Afterwards, a yellow dragon appeared at Chengji. Then Emperor Wen summoned Gongsun Chen to serve as doctor, drafted the calendar system for earth virtue, and changed the first year.

sentences.zh: 張丞相由此自絀，謝病稱老。

translations.literal: Zhang chancellor from this self diminish, apologize illness claim old.
translations.idiomatic: From this, Chancellor Zhang diminished himself, claimed illness, and professed old age.

sentences.zh: 蒼任人為中候，大為姦利，上以讓蒼，蒼遂病免。

translations.literal: Cang appoint person as middle guard, greatly for evil profit, sovereign with reprimand Cang, Cang then illness dismiss.
translations.idiomatic: Cang appointed someone as middle guard who greatly engaged in evil profiteering. The sovereign reprimanded Cang for this, and Cang then claimed illness and was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 蒼為丞相十五歲而免。

translations.literal: Cang be chancellor fifteen years and dismiss.
translations.idiomatic: Cang served as chancellor for fifteen years and was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 孝景前五年，蒼卒，謚為文侯。

translations.literal: Xiao Jing before five year, Cang die, posthumous title as Wen marquis.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year before Xiaojing's reign, Cang died, posthumously titled Marquis Wen.

sentences.zh: 子康侯代，八年卒。

translations.literal: Son Kang marquis replace, eight years die.
translations.idiomatic: His son Marquis Kang succeeded him and died after eight years.

sentences.zh: 子類代為侯，八年，坐臨諸侯喪後就位不敬，國除。

translations.literal: Son Lei replace as marquis, eight years, sit attend feudal lords mourning after take position not respectful, state eliminate.
translations.idiomatic: His son Lei succeeded as marquis. After eight years, convicted of taking his position disrespectfully after attending feudal lords' mourning, the state was abolished.

sentences.zh: 初，張蒼父長不滿五尺，及生蒼，蒼長八尺餘，為侯、丞相。

translations.literal: Initially, Zhang Cang father length not full five chi, reach give birth Cang, Cang length eight chi more, be marquis, chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Zhang Cang's father was not full five chi in height. When he gave birth to Cang, Cang was over eight chi tall, and became marquis and chancellor.

sentences.zh: 蒼子復長。

translations.literal: Cang son again tall.
translations.idiomatic: Cang's son was tall again.

sentences.zh: 及孫類，長六尺餘，坐法失侯。

translations.literal: Reach grandson Lei, length six chi more, sit law lose marquis.
translations.idiomatic: When it came to grandson Lei, he was over six chi tall, but lost his marquisate through violation of law.

sentences.zh: 蒼之免相後，老，口中無齒，食乳，女子為乳母。

translations.literal: Cang of dismiss chancellor after, old, mouth middle no teeth, eat milk, woman be wet nurse.
translations.idiomatic: After Cang was dismissed as chancellor, he grew old. His mouth had no teeth, he drank milk, and women served as wet nurses.

sentences.zh: 妻妾以百數，嘗孕者不復幸。

translations.literal: Wife concubines with hundred number, once pregnant ones no again favor.
translations.idiomatic: His wives and concubines numbered in the hundreds, but those who once became pregnant he no longer favored.

sentences.zh: 蒼年百有餘歲而卒。

translations.literal: Cang age hundred have more years and die.
translations.idiomatic: Cang lived over a hundred years and died.

sentences.zh: 申屠丞相嘉者，梁人，以材官蹶張從高帝擊項籍，遷為隊率。

translations.literal: Shen Tu chancellor Jia person, Liang person, with timber officer crossbow follow Gao emperor strike Xiang Ji, move as troop commander.
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Shen Tu Jia was a man from Liang. As a timber officer with crossbow, he followed Gao emperor in striking Xiang Ji and was promoted to troop commander.

sentences.zh: 從擊黥布軍，為都尉。

translations.literal: Follow strike Qing Bu army, be chief commander.
translations.idiomatic: He followed in striking Qing Bu's army and became chief commander.

sentences.zh: 孝惠時，為淮陽守。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui time, be Huai Yang guard.
translations.idiomatic: During Xiaohui's time, he served as Huaiyang governor.

sentences.zh: 孝文帝元年，舉故吏士二千石從高皇帝者，悉以為關內侯，食邑二十四人，而申屠嘉食邑五百戶。

translations.literal: Xiao Wen emperor first year, select former officials gentlemen two thousand dan follow Gao emperor ones, all make as pass inner marquis, food fief twenty four persons, but Shen Tu Jia food fief five hundred households.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Emperor Xiaowen, they selected former officials and gentlemen of two thousand dan who followed Gao emperor. All were made Guan Nei marquises with food fiefs - twenty-four persons, and Shen Tu Jia received a food fief of five hundred households.

sentences.zh: 張蒼已為丞相，嘉遷為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Zhang Cang already be chancellor, Jia move as censor grand master.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhang Cang had become chancellor, Jia was promoted to Censor Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 張蒼免相，孝文帝欲用皇后弟竇廣國為丞相，曰：「恐天下以吾私廣國。」

translations.literal: Zhang Cang dismiss chancellor, Xiao Wen emperor wish use empress younger brother Dou Guang Guo as chancellor, say: Fear world with I private Guang Guo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Cang was dismissed as chancellor. Emperor Xiaowen wished to use the empress's younger brother Dou Guangguo as chancellor, saying: 'I fear the world will think I favor Guangguo privately.'

sentences.zh: 廣國賢有行，故欲相之，念久之不可，而高帝時大臣又皆多死，餘見無可者，乃以御史大夫嘉為丞相，因故邑封為故安侯。

translations.literal: Guang Guo worthy have conduct, therefore wish chancellor him, think long time not able, but Gao emperor time great ministers again all many die, remaining see no suitable ones, then with censor grand master Jia as chancellor, follow old fief enfeoff as Gu An marquis.
translations.idiomatic: Guangguo was worthy and had good conduct, so he wished to make him chancellor. After thinking about it for a long time, he decided it was not possible. Moreover, the great ministers from Gao emperor's time had mostly died, and there were no suitable ones remaining. So he made Censor Grand Master Jia chancellor, and enfeoffed him as Marquis of Guan according to his old fief.

sentences.zh: 嘉為人廉直，門不受私謁。

translations.literal: Jia as person incorruptible straight, gate not accept private visits.
translations.idiomatic: Jia as a person was incorruptible and straightforward. His gate did not accept private visits.

sentences.zh: 是時太中大夫鄧通方隆愛幸，賞賜累巨萬。

translations.literal: This time grand central gentleman Deng Tong just high favor fortune, rewards accumulate great ten thousand.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Grand Central Gentleman Deng Tong was greatly favored and fortunate, with rewards accumulating to great tens of thousands.

sentences.zh: 文帝嘗燕飲通家，其寵如是。

translations.literal: Wen emperor once feast drink Tong home, his favor like this.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen once feasted and drank at Tong's home - his favor was like this.

sentences.zh: 是時丞相入朝，而通居上傍，有怠慢之禮。

translations.literal: This time chancellor enter court, but Tong reside sovereign side, have disrespectful of ritual.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the chancellor entered court, but Tong sat beside the sovereign with disrespectful ritual.

sentences.zh: 丞相奏事畢，因言曰：「陛下愛幸臣，則富貴之；

translations.literal: Chancellor memorialize affairs finish, then speak say: Your majesty love favor minister, then wealthy noble it;
translations.idiomatic: After the chancellor finished memorializing affairs, he then said: 'Your Majesty loves and favors this minister, then make him wealthy and noble;'

sentences.zh: 至於朝廷之禮，不可以不肅！」

translations.literal: Until court of ritual, not can not solemn!
translations.idiomatic: 'But as for court ritual, it cannot but be solemn!'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「君勿言，吾私之。」

translations.literal: Sovereign say: You not speak, I private it.
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign said: 'You don't speak. I favor him privately.'

sentences.zh: 罷朝坐府中，嘉為檄召鄧通詣丞相府，不來，且斬通。

translations.literal: Dismiss court sit mansion middle, Jia for dispatch summon Deng Tong go chancellor mansion, not come, and behead Tong.
translations.idiomatic: After dismissing court, he sat in his mansion. Jia issued a dispatch summoning Deng Tong to the chancellor's mansion. If he did not come, he would behead Tong.

sentences.zh: 通恐，入言文帝。

translations.literal: Tong fear, enter speak Wen emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Tong was afraid and entered to speak to Emperor Wen.

sentences.zh: 文帝曰：「汝第往，吾今使人召若。」

translations.literal: Wen emperor say: You just go, I now make person summon you.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen said: 'You just go. I will now send someone to summon you.'

sentences.zh: 通至丞相府，免冠，徒跣，頓首謝。

translations.literal: Tong arrive chancellor mansion, remove hat, barefoot, kowtow apologize.
translations.idiomatic: Tong arrived at the chancellor's mansion, removed his hat, went barefoot, and kowtowed in apology.

sentences.zh: 嘉坐自如，故不為禮，責曰：「夫朝廷者，高皇帝之朝廷也。

translations.literal: Jia sit self like, intentionally not do ritual, blame say: Now court ones, Gao emperor of court.
translations.idiomatic: Jia sat as usual, intentionally did not perform ritual, and blamed saying: 'The court is Gao emperor's court.

sentences.zh: 通小臣，戲殿上，大不敬，當斬。

translations.literal: Tong small minister, play hall on, great not respectful, should behead.
translations.idiomatic: Tong is a small minister who played in the hall - greatly disrespectful, should be beheaded.

sentences.zh: 吏今行斬之！」

translations.literal: Official now carry out behead him!
translations.idiomatic: The official now carry out beheading him!'

sentences.zh: 通頓首，首盡出血，不解。

translations.literal: Tong kowtow, head completely bleed, not stop.
translations.idiomatic: Tong kowtowed until his head bled completely, but did not stop.

sentences.zh: 文帝度丞相已困通，使使者持節召通，而謝丞相曰：「此吾弄臣，君釋之。」

translations.literal: Wen emperor measure chancellor already embarrass Tong, make messenger hold tally summon Tong, but apologize chancellor say: This I play minister, you release him.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen saw that the chancellor had already embarrassed Tong, so he sent a messenger holding a tally to summon Tong, and apologized to the chancellor saying: 'This is my plaything minister. You release him.'

sentences.zh: 鄧通既至，為文帝泣曰：「丞相幾殺臣。」

translations.literal: Deng Tong already arrive, for Wen emperor weep say: Chancellor almost kill minister.
translations.idiomatic: When Deng Tong arrived, he wept to Emperor Wen saying: 'The chancellor almost killed this minister.'

sentences.zh: 嘉為丞相五歲，孝文帝崩，孝景帝即位。

translations.literal: Jia be chancellor five years, Xiao Wen emperor collapse, Xiao Jing emperor ascend throne.
translations.idiomatic: Jia served as chancellor for five years. Emperor Xiaowen collapsed, and Emperor Xiaojing ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 二年，晁錯為內史，貴幸用事，諸法令多所請變更，議以謫罰侵削諸侯。

translations.literal: Two year, Chao Cuo be inner secretary, noble fortunate handle affairs, various laws commands many request change, discuss with demotion punishment erode cut feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Chao Cuo served as inner secretary, was noble and fortunate, handled affairs. He requested many changes to various laws and commands, discussing using demotion and punishment to erode and cut back the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 而丞相嘉自絀所言不用，疾錯。

translations.literal: But chancellor Jia self diminish what speak not use, hate Cuo.
translations.idiomatic: But Chancellor Jia diminished himself, and what he said was not used. He hated Cuo.

sentences.zh: 錯為內史，門東出，不便，更穿一門南出。

translations.literal: Cuo be inner secretary, gate east exit, not convenient, change dig one gate south exit.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo as inner secretary had his gate exit east, which was inconvenient, so he changed it to dig another gate exiting south.

sentences.zh: 南出者，太上皇廟堧垣。

translations.literal: South exit ones, great supreme emperor temple side wall.
translations.idiomatic: The south exit was beside the Great Supreme Emperor's temple wall.

sentences.zh: 嘉聞之，欲因此以法錯擅穿宗廟垣為門，奏請誅錯。

translations.literal: Jia hear it, wish therefore with law Cuo presumptuously dig ancestral temple wall as gate, memorialize request execute Cuo.
translations.idiomatic: Jia heard this and wished to use this to accuse Cuo by law of presumptuously digging the ancestral temple wall as a gate, memorializing to request executing Cuo.

sentences.zh: 錯客有語錯，錯恐，夜入宮上謁，自歸景帝。

translations.literal: Cuo guest have speak Cuo, Cuo fear, night enter palace go audience, self surrender Jing emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Cuo's guest spoke to Cuo. Cuo was afraid and entered the palace at night to have audience, surrendering himself to Emperor Jing.

sentences.zh: 至朝，丞相奏請誅內史錯。

translations.literal: Arrive court, chancellor memorialize request execute inner secretary Cuo.
translations.idiomatic: When court arrived, the chancellor memorialized requesting to execute Inner Secretary Cuo.

sentences.zh: 景帝曰：「錯所穿非真廟垣，乃外堧垣，故他官居其中，且又我使為之，錯無罪。」
罷朝，嘉謂長史曰：「吾悔不先斬錯，乃先請之，為錯所賣。」
至舍，因歐血而死。
謚為節侯。
子共侯蔑代，三年卒。
子侯去病代，三十一年卒。
子侯臾代，六歲，坐為九江太守受故官送有罪，國除。
自申屠嘉死之後，景帝時開封侯陶青、桃侯劉舍為丞相。
及今上時，柏至侯許昌、平棘侯薛澤、武彊侯莊青翟、高陵侯趙周等為丞相。
皆以列侯繼嗣，娖娖廉謹，為丞相備員而已，無所能發明功名有著於當世者。
太史公曰：「張蒼文學律歷，為漢名相，而絀賈生、公孫臣等言正朔服色事而不遵，明用秦之顓頊歷，何哉？
周昌，木彊人也。
任敖以舊德用。
申屠嘉可謂剛毅守節矣，然無術學，殆與蕭、曹、陳平異矣。
孝武時丞相多甚，不記，莫錄其行起居狀略，且紀征和以來。
有車丞相，長陵人也。
卒而有韋丞相代。
韋丞相賢者，魯人也。
以讀書術為吏，至大鴻臚。
有相工相之，當至丞相。
有男四人，使相工相之，至第二子，其名玄成。
相工曰：「此子貴，當封。」
韋丞相言曰：「我即為丞相，有長子，是安從得之？」
後竟為丞相，病死，而長子有罪論，不得嗣，而立玄成。
玄成時佯狂，不肯立，竟立之，有讓國之名。
後坐騎至廟，不敬，有詔奪爵一級，為關內侯，失列侯，得食其故國邑。
韋丞相卒，有魏丞相代。
魏丞相相者，濟陰人也。
以文吏至丞相。
其人好武，皆令諸吏帶劍，帶劍前奏事。
或有不帶劍者，當入奏事，至乃借劍而敢入奏事。
其時京兆尹趙君，丞相奏以免罪，使人執魏丞相，欲求脫罪而不聽。
復使人脅恐魏丞相，以夫人賊殺待婢事而私獨奏請驗之，發吏卒至丞相舍，捕奴婢笞擊問之，實不以兵刃殺也。
而丞相司直繁君奏京兆尹趙君迫脅丞相，誣以夫人賊殺婢，發吏卒圍捕丞相舍，不道；
又得擅屏騎士事，趙京兆坐要斬。
又有使掾陳平等劾中尚書，疑以獨擅劫事而坐之，大不敬，長史以下皆坐死，或下蠶室。
而魏丞相竟以丞相病死。
子嗣。
後坐騎至廟，不敬，有詔奪爵一級，為關內侯，失列侯，得食其故國邑。
魏丞相卒，以御史大夫邴吉代。
邴丞相吉者，魯國人也。
以讀書好法令至御史大夫。
孝宣帝時，以有舊故，封為列侯，而因為丞相。
明於事，有大智，後世稱之。
以丞相病死。
子顯嗣。
後坐騎至廟，不敬，有詔奪爵一級，失列侯，得食故國邑。
顯為吏至太仆，坐官秏亂，身及子男有姦贓，免為庶人。
邴丞相卒，黃丞相代。
長安中有善相工田文者，與韋丞相、魏丞相、邴丞相微賤時會於客家，田文言曰：「今此三君者，皆丞相也。」
其後三人竟更相代為丞相，何見之明也。
黃丞相霸者，淮陽人也。
以讀書為吏，至潁川太守。
治潁川，以禮義條教喻告化之。
犯法者，風曉令自殺。
化大行，名聲聞。
孝宣帝下制曰：「潁川太守霸，以宣布詔令治民，道不拾遺，男女異路，獄中無重囚。
賜爵關內侯，黃金百斤。」
徵為京兆尹而至丞相，復以禮義為治。
以丞相病死。
子嗣，後為列侯。
黃丞相卒，以御史大夫于定國代。
于丞相已有廷尉傳，在張廷尉語中。
于丞相去，御史大夫韋玄成代。
韋丞相玄成者，即前韋丞相子也。
代父，後失列侯。
其人少時好讀書，明於詩、論語。
為吏至衛尉，徙為太子太傅。
御史大夫薛君免，為御史大夫。
于丞相乞骸骨免，而為丞相，因封故邑為扶陽侯。
數年，病死。
孝元帝親臨喪，賜賞甚厚。
子嗣後。
其治容容隨世俗浮沈，而見謂諂巧。
而相工本謂之當為侯代父，而後失之；
復自游宦而起，至丞相。
父子俱為丞相，世閒美之，豈不命哉！
相工其先知之。
韋丞相卒，御史大夫匡衡代。
丞相匡衡者，東海人也。
好讀書，從博士受詩。
家貧，衡傭作以給食飲。
才下，數射策不中，至九，乃中丙科。
其經以不中科故明習。
補平原文學卒史。
數年，郡不尊敬。
御史徵之，以補百石屬薦為郎，而補博士，拜為太子少傅，而事孝元帝。
孝元好詩，而遷為光祿勳，居殿中為師，授教左右，而縣官坐其旁聽，甚善之，日以尊貴。
御史大夫鄭弘坐事免，而匡君為御史大夫。
歲餘，韋丞相死，匡君代為丞相，封樂安侯。
以十年之閒，不出長安城門而至丞相，豈非遇時而命也哉！
太史公曰：深惟士之游宦所以至封侯者，微甚。
然多至御史大夫即去者。
諸為大夫而丞相次也，其心冀幸丞相物故也。
或乃陰私相毀害，欲代之。
然守之日久不得，或為之日少而得之，至於封侯，真命也夫！
御史大夫鄭君守之數年不得，匡君居之未滿歲，而韋丞相死，即代之矣，豈可以智巧得哉！
多有賢聖之才，困妯囡者眾甚也。
